title: In-season
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has viewed the team page of a team during the regular season
and then navs to the device's Search section
and then taps on the team's "overview"

(tap into device Search; it should populate under "Siri Suggestions")
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the team's previous and next games
as well as a news article

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing the game cells in the team overview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all information will be accurate 
(team names, logos, pitcher data, scores, game state)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps any of the content (game cell or news article)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the team page

title: Postseason
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device
custom_steps:
When the user has viewed the team page of a team currently in the Postseason
and then navs to the device's Search section
and taps on the team's "overview"
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the team's previous & next games
and all the Postseason info will appear correctly (i.e. "ALCS Game 2: BOS leads 1-0")

title: Offseason
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has viewed the team page of a team during the Offseason
and then navs to the device's Search section
and then taps on the team's "overview"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see three team news articles

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the news articles
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the team page

title: Creating App Shortcuts
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has navigated to various views in the app
and then navs to device Settings > Siri & Search
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the At Bat views listed under "Suggested Shortcuts"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps to add one of the At Bat suggested shortcuts
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to record a personalized phrase that when spoken to Siri, will be used to take the user to the app shortcut

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user speaks the personalized phrase to Siri
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be deep-linked to that specific view in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to "My Shortcuts" in the Siri Shortcuts section of the device's Siri settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see all their personalized Siri shortcuts
and will be able to edit them as they see fit

title: App Shortcuts
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device
custom_steps:
When the user has created shortcuts for each of the following views in At Bat
and speaks each command into Siri

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that specific team's page will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Standings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Standings view will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Stats
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Stats view will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scoreboard view will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: MLB News
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB News index will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Team News
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that specific team's news index will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: MLB Videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB Video index will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Videos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then that specific team's video index will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: MLB.TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB.TV EPG will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio EPG will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: MLB Network
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB Network view will launch in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: Ask At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Ask At Bat bot will launch in At Bat

title: Special Cases with Shortcuts
custom_preconds:
Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device
and the user has created At Bat Siri shortcuts

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a team's News index
and leaves the app
and launches the MLB News index via Siri shortcut
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken the MLB News index
and not the previously viewed team index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing the MLB News index
and leaves the app
and launches a team News index via Siri shortcut
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken the team's News index
and not the previously viewed MLB index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a team's Video index
and leaves the app
and launches the MLB Video index via Siri shortcut
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken the MLB Video index
and not the previously viewed team index

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing the MLB Video index
and leaves the app
and launches a team Video index via Siri shortcut
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken the team's Video index
and not the previously viewed MLB index

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Lite user launches the Audio EPG via Siri shortcut
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the At Bat paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Lite user launches the MLB.TV EPG via Siri shortcut
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB.TV upsell at the top of the EPG

title: Team Overview
custom_preconds: Given the user has At Bat installed on an iOS 12 or higher device

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user sees a team overview available as a Siri shortcut in the device's Siri settings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user can record a personalized phrase for the team overview

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user calls the personalized team overview phrase in Siri
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team overview will launch in the Siri interface

reg season/postseason: game cells & 1 news article
offseason/elim from postseason: 3 news articles

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps any of the content in the team overview
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to the team page in At Bat
